revised_title: British Radio Observations During the Second International Polar Year 1932-33
tldr: This article discusses radio observations made by British researchers during the Second International Polar Year 1932-33. They used radio waves to explore upper-atmospheric electrification and studied the ionosphere. The research was conducted in collaboration with the Union Radio Scientifique Internationale and involved stations in Tromso, Norway, and Simavik, Canada. The findings contributed to the understanding of the Earth's atmosphere and weather patterns.
